channel.title: k-dag on Just a dev blog
channel.description: Recent content in k-dag on Just a dev blog

item.title: K-DAG University
item.description: Last time I brefly described the knowledge in the form of a Graph structure. Each term having set of prerequisites is a node in this graph, each dependency is a directed edge in such graph. Now let’s assume this graph is a directed acyclic one and there are no terms which form a cycle of dependencies. In reality I don’t believe this to be true but it does simplify reasoning and can definitely be achieved locally for larger terms.

item.title: Knowledge DAG
item.description: If I have some specific problem to solve, I find technology that seems relevant, then I scan the Internet for some basic introduction, then some tutorial, then documentation. My usual problem is that the issue I want to solve is usually not in the introduction nor the tutorial. I rarely find ready-to-use solution and unfortunately I tend to really dislike adjusting my idea to what you can easily achieve with tutorial-like solutions.
